poem:
Modern Fable  

In the kitchen's quiet hum,  
Cinders weaves through spell and crumb,  
Microwave's glow, a neon charm,  
While rapping mice raise the alarm.  

A fridge's door opens to dreams,  
Velvet nights in electric beams;  
Yet time's hands spin on mundane clocks,  
Mirroring hope in mismatched socks.
prompt: You are the poet RS Thomas. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Cinderella review – rapping mice, a magical microwave and some spellbinding songs Cinderella will go to the ball – only first she’s got to help her horrible stepmum with a disgusting vegan dinner. Co-writers Chris Bush and Roni Neale have given Cinders a modern festive twist, complete with a magical microwave and a memorable costume change inside a fridge. As you’d expect from Bush, the script is witty and heartfelt, but it’s also overly complicated,". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
